title: Message Processing Issue - Downloading Stops, Messages Stay on Server
content:
I get the message: The account mbanish@zoomtown.com is being processed. Please wait until processing is complete to get messages.

And then Thunderbird stops loading messages. When I restart, it starts loading them again, but the same ones because it didn't finish and pull them off the server (POP3) the last time.

I have gone to the server at AltaFiber (Cincinnati Bell, my Internet Service Provider) and deleted messages that appear to be stopping the download, but that didn't help. It stopped again.

Please help. This has been going on for a few months now, and I keep having to get messages using Gmail and going directly to the Server. I need to know what's going on and fix this.

Mike Banish mbanish@zoomtown.com
creator: mbanish

title: Hide individual inboxes in unified view left pane
content:
Thunderbird updated itself to Version 112.0b7 and I've lost the ability to hide the individual email accounts in the left pane. I have the account Server Settings --> Message Storage --> Advanced set to store incoming mail in Local Folders. That's the option (When downloading mail from this account's server, use the following folder to store new messages:) This is set to -- Inbox for different account --> [Local Folders]

Previous versions hid all the other individual mailboxes that were stacked on top of the Local Folders. The update seems to have broken that ability. Is there another way to get rid of all those accounts above the Local Folders?
creator: ff80

title: Download of Thunderbird not happening!
content:
Hello Thunderbird/Firefox People,

I've tried to download Thunderbird onto my new computer (with Windows 11 OS), so that I can transfer the Thunderbird files from my old Thunderbird account on the old computer, but the download doesn't start! I just get a page with a "Retry" button (if download doesn't start automatically). But the browser times out in a few seconds, so I press "Retry" again and again! I found I was "forced" to make a donation before I could progress with to the download page, which was not good. I even retried the whole process, this time paying the minimum "donation" of $8 AUD, but still no downloads happened, after numerous "Retry" button pressing. What is the problem? Why can't I download? I do not want to make anymore donations! Is there a way to choose not to donate? Please help! Chris B.
creator: cbattle53

title: Thuderbird attach files
content: I've just upgraded Thunderbird to the latest version (102.10.0 (64-bit)) running under Win 10 to be able to use current security to access my academic account. Since doing that I can't attach files to outgoing messages - the file pane opens and Tbird freezes (not responding). I can only get out of that by closing the program. The problem persist even in safe mode
creator: norman.billingham

title: Suddenly can't log onto 3 email servers but they work okay on iPad or when I log onto them individually via web-based email clients.
content:
I have no idea what the problem is. Suddenly last night I started getting messages that I needed to enter a PW to log onto my three email servers, but each attempt was met by another request to log onto the server. I can use email just fine on my iPad and I can log onto the servers individually using web-based email clients, so I know what the current passwords are, it's just that when I use those passwords in Thunderbird it doesn't work. I bounced Windows and the router to no avail. The only big recent event in Thunderbird was that I moved it from the C drive to the D drive (an external SSD) in preparation for moving to a new Dell computer. It worked fine - I've been using Thunderbird on my new Dell Windows 11 computer for a couple of weeks. My Thunderbird is at 102.10.0. I tried changing the Authentication Method from "Normal Password" to "Encrypted" for one of the email servers but I got a message from Thunderbird telling me that the site didn't support encryption and that I should change it back to "Normal Password", which I did.

The only thing I could imagine was that some recent Thunderbird maintenance introduced a problem so I hoped that I'd discover that the problem was fixed with new maintenance this morning. Didn't happen. I'm at a loss and it's really upsetting me. Please help. Thank you.
creator: tcluster

title: Email not sent because of spam
content:
If I send an email that contains a link (I do this to invite my students in online classes), the mail is not being sent. I get a bounce back message: 

host smtp.antispamcloud.com [130.117.54.107]    SMTP error from remote mail server after end of data:    550 High probability of spam


Reporting-MTA: dns; s542.fra6.mysecurecloudhost.com

title: spazio su disco (cartella ImapMail) + crash o rallentamento (apparentemente legato a) compattazione cartelle
content: Ciao a tutto, da qualche tempo ho notato che la compattazione cartelle (in particolare) produce dei rallentamenti o dei blocchi del sistema. Mi sembra che sia la compattazione di thunderbird a causare questo, ma poi si blocca windows in generale. Oggi mi sono reso conto di una cosa che forse è in relazione a questa, forse è un problema aggiuntivo. La cartella seguente C:\Users\wespy\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\txpij6cc.default-release\ImapMail occupa quasi 61 giga su disco. Mi pare strano, in generale, e anche perché sulla casella gmail lo spazio occupato risulta meno di 10 giga. Consigli? Grazie.

title: I've enclosed the sort by date from my Sent folder. The first several entries (latest->oldest) seem to be in the incorrect order
content:

The sort (see image) seems to be out of order. How can I get the sort (esp. the sort on today's email to be correct?

Note that Thunderbird is sorting the dates as follows (today is 4/12):

Date Correspondents ... 4/11/23, 10:20 , 10:20 PM ... 10:44 AM . 4/10, 10:35 AM ... 2/28/23, 7:32 AM ... 4/9/23/, 1:44 PM ... 4/8/23, 1:13pm ... . . .

Q's 1. Today is 4/12. Why does the first entry from 4/11/23 2. Why isn't the second entry "4/12/, 1044 AM"? 3. Why is the entry for 2/28/23 with my February dates rather than in the above sequence?

The rest of the date column is sorted correctly.

Thank you.

creator: JeffL

title: Setting up a redundant computer to use primary's backed up profile when primary is down and different passwords required for each machine.
content:
I currently have TB 102 running on a Linux Mint desktop. The email is POP3 from att (actually snet). They require a different app password for each computer. I have the different app password. I want to use my Linux Mint laptop to access my email and use a backup of the desktop's profile when the desktop is out of service. Laptop does not have any .thunderdird folder yet as TB has not been started. I am looking at the http://mzl.la/1ApHiU3 support page. It seems that these instructions are replacing Laptop's hidden .thunderbird folder with desktop's .thunderbird folder. This seems odd since Step3 of "On your Destination Computer", opens Thunderbird. Won't that create a .thunderbird folder with new installs.ini and profiles.ini files? They will be replaced in Step8.

I am concerned that Step3's newly created .ini files (which have a different hash that links them) will be lost in Step8 and there is some dependency on that hash value that is not clear. Is that hash sent to the email server so that they can identify the machine/app that is accessing their server?

Is there a more appropriate support page for what I need to do? I am not clear on the subsequent steps to launch TB on the laptop and change the password on the laptop. At some point I would need to reverse the direction to bring the Laptop's Profile back to the Desktop. Any advice would be appreciated.
creator: laurencegregg

title: Reply Windows Open with Menus Focused
content:
thunderbird-102.8.0-1.fc37.x86_64 Fedora release 37 (Thirty Seven)

Whenever I click "Reply" on a message, the Write window opens with the menu focused. If I type any key to start the message, the corresponding menu item is executed.

For example: Starting to type "Hi" in the reply, executes the Help menu item and switches to Firefox and opens a tab.

To avoid this, I have to click in the message body to un-focus the menu and then start typing.

Thanks

title: All configurations suddenly disappeared
content: Hello, I just got some issues with Thunderbird: As I opened it, everything was gone and it showed the Account setup page, as if I had just installed it. So the whole server configuration was gone, but somehow the passwords were still available (in settings/security/passwords) Then I checked the profile folder in the debugging information, and it is still there, with all the data, but TB seems to be unable to access it. I just can't could have happen here, because it was all of a sudden, and nothing that could have caused this issue. Update to v102 was working well, and there was no crash. So has somebody any idea what could have happened, and what to do to fix this issue?
creator: bsalesse
